bibl.title: Letter from Robert P. Cooke to Philip Showalter Hench, October 17, 1940

div1.p: Cooke informs Hench that he will not attend the Lazear memorial event. He describes the experimental building at Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Robert P. Cooke to Philip Showalter Hench, October 17, 1940

opener.dateline:
COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA
STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
LEXINGTON-ROCKBRIDGE HEALTH DEPARTMENT
LEXINGTON, VIRGINIA
Lexington Va
Oct. 17th 1940

div1.p:
Your letter of the 14th is very interesting and
I am really terribly sorry that I won't have the privilge
of meeting you and the others at W & J but my
duties here as Health Officer make it impossible for me
to come- I was much interested to know that you now
located one of the experimental buildings and am
trying to remember the details you ask for- The location
of the stove I think was on the left as you enter
and as I recall, the roof was the ordinary type
(triangular) with a moderate angle- I think Agramontes
drawing is substantially correct - The details didnt make
much impression on me at the time and its been a
long time ago. I do recall that I slept on the cot
to the right of the door and I think there was only one window
COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA
STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
LEXINGTON-ROCKBRIDGE HEALTH DEPARTMENT
LEXINGTON, VIRGINIA
but am not certain. There was no fence around the camp
as I remember but the buildings were enclosed.
The inside construction was tongue and groove I am
fairly certain. I am sorry to say I have no [?]
of the buildings as of those at Columbia Bks.
I have a letter from Agramonte written about 1902
enclosing articles dealing with phases of Reeds
work and his part in it which I will gladly
send you if you would care to see them.

It would give me real pleasure doctor to meet
you should you be in Virginia at any time-
I ought to be able to remember more details of this ex
perience I don't think we had much idea, at the time
that anyone would be particularly interested. I dont think
there was a ceiling to the room in bldg 1 just rafters but
of this I am not certain, wishing I could be of more help
in recalling what you want to know and with cordial
regards
